image.altText: A court sketch of Keith Russell Yandle.

props.synopsis: Convicted killer Keith Russell Yandle, whose victim was found buried at a property north of Adelaide in 2023, has been jailed for 32 years over the "calculated, ruthless" shooting murder.

title.children: Killer jailed for 32 years over 'calculated, ruthless' murder

image.altText: A design proposal for the former Glenside hospital site.

props.synopsis: The South Australian government has approved a developer's controversial bid to build apartments of up to 20 storeys in Adelaide's inner-eastern suburbs.

title.children: Rezoning approved for 20-storey apartments outside Adelaide CBD

image.altText: Woman with respiratory illness, blowing her nose into handkerchief.

props.synopsis: Reported flu cases across South Australia have spiked 70 per cent this year, with more than 1,000 cases in the last week alone. It has coincided with another rise in ambulance ramping, which soared in June to its second-highest level on record.

title.children: 'Alarming' spike in SA flu cases as ambulance ramping soars again

image.altText: The headquarters of oil and gas company Santos.

props.synopsis: There are fears for around 50 jobs at the regional SA site as the company looks to "simplify" operations.

title.children: Regional SA jobs at risk as Santos reviews Port Bonython site

image.altText: A hand holds a remote pointed towards a large TV.

props.synopsis: Earlier this week its free-to-air channels were replaced with red screens when Seven West Media and WIN TV failed to agree on how much Seven would pay WIN to broadcast its programming.

title.children: Channel 7 back on air in regional SA, NSW after securing new WIN deal

image.altText: A man with short brown hair wearing a black tshirt is kneeling down and patting a dog.

props.synopsis: Port Lincoln's mayor says the grisly nature of the alleged murder of one of the town's long-time residents has been acutely felt in the community.

title.children: Coastal town reels after man allegedly killed by reality TV contestant

image.altText: A white sign with green and black text and a basic map of Orana's properties. A plant is blurred in the foreground.

props.synopsis: A magistrate is scathing of the 38-year-old woman's use of clients' bank cards at a residential care facility, disputing claims that she was in a "complete drug psychosis" at the time of offending.

title.children: Disability worker's theft from clients 'a betrayal without decency'

image.altText: A woman in a red outfit standing in front of a door frame with her hand on a signboard and a stern expression.

props.synopsis: Eighteen regional art galleries in New South Wales are facing an uncertain future after missing out on four years' worth of government funding.

title.children: Outback artists slam regional funding shortfall

image.altText: A male hand holds a mobile phone viewed from the side.

props.synopsis: The SA government is investigating whether it can bring forward a ban on mobile phones in childcare centres, following allegations of child abuse material being produced by a man at a Victorian childcare centre.

title.children: SA looks to fast-track ban on mobile phones in childcare centres

image.altText: A CCTV still shows perpetrator walking and holding what police allege is a knife.

props.synopsis: The father, mother and brother of a woman who was the victim of an "honour" stabbing in Adelaide's north have had their sentences reduced.

title.children: Sentences reduced for family members convicted over 'honour' stabbing

image.altText: A woman applies sunscreen to her arm. A pool can be seen in the background.

props.synopsis: At least eight sunscreens that failed to meet their advertised SPF50 sun protection claims in a recent review had their original tests for certification done by an overseas laboratory whose results are being questioned by industry experts.

title.children: Eight sunscreens that failed their SPF claims tested by same overseas lab

image.altText: A man with a beard wearing a check shirt, standing in front of a sign that says Golden North Ice Cream

props.synopsis: Locals say Golden North and the SA town of Laura are synonymous with each other, but the ice cream manufacturer is set to close its local factory.

title.children: SA town shocked at Golden North ice cream's exit

image.altText: hand-knitted teddy bears piled on a hospital bed

props.synopsis: Willy Weidenhofer's hand-knitted trauma teddies have been handed out to hundreds of children in ambulances or the emergency department during a trip to the local hospital.

title.children: Hundreds of handmade 'trauma teddies' comfort young patients

image.altText: A man wearing a police uniform.

props.synopsis: A newspaper article published this week reported a "high-ranking" SA police officer had accidentally fired their gun while attending a house in suburban Adelaide during the 1990s. Here's how the commissioner responded.

title.children: SA's police chief has opened up about a 1991 firearm incident — here's what was said

image.altText: Phil Walsh smiles while speaking to the media

props.synopsis: When Crows supporters awoke on the morning of July 3, 2015 to the news that their club's coach had been fatally stabbed in his own home at Somerton Park, the shock and anguish were both immediate and palpable.

title.children: Phil Walsh's death a decade ago united footy fans divided by their Showdown

image.altText: A fiddler ray with reddish tinges

props.synopsis: Dozens of sharks and rays collected from Adelaide beaches will be studied to find out how they were killed by the algal bloom amid fears of future local extinctions.

title.children: Adelaide residents rally to collect deluge of dead marine life from algal bloom

image.altText: A close up of a man wearing a suit speaking.

props.synopsis: Reforms that would standardise Working with Children Checks across the country "can't happen soon enough", the federal education minister says, in the wake of allegations of child sexual abuse at a Victorian childcare centre.

title.children: 'It's taken too long': Minister criticises Working with Children Check reforms

image.altText: Julio César Chávez Jr punches Jake Paul with a right hook to the head

props.synopsis: Famed Mexican boxer Julio César Chávez Jr is arrested in the United States just days after he fought influencer-turned-boxer Jake Paul in California.

title.children: ICE arrests Mexican boxer in US days after fight against Jake Paul

image.altText: A woman talking into an ABC News microphone, with two police officers standing either side of her.

props.synopsis: The NT government will rewrite youth crime laws this month to reclassify 13 offences as "serious", requiring children who commit them to attend court rather than go through youth diversion.

title.children: 'Will not tolerate repeat offenders': NT flags youth crime law changes

image.altText: A young man smiling at the camera, wearing a tuxedo as he stands inside a living room.

props.synopsis: NSW Police allege the boys — 17 and 16 — donned dark clothing and approached "innocent" 21-year-old Luke Manassa in Sydney's west last Thursday night.

title.children: Man stabbed in case of 'mistaken identity' contract killing, police say

image.altText: A silhouette of a hand holds a mobile phone with a blank white screen

props.synopsis: I was transferring my mobile number to a new provider when my phone service cut out. That was my first clue that my identity had been stolen.

title.children: I was a victim of cybercrime. This is what I wished I'd paid attention to

image.altText: ADHD meds

props.synopsis: Some of the most common medications for ADHD are set to be in short supply until the end of the year, which means plenty of people across Australia may find their pharmacist can't fill their prescriptions.

title.children: Why ADHD meds are in short supply, and what can you do about it

image.altText: A member of staff places the comic book titled 'The Future I saw' on a shelf.

props.synopsis: Japan has seen record numbers of visitors this year. But viral rumours of impending disaster stemming from a comic book prediction have reportedly impacted the tourism boom, with some airlines cancelling flights.

title.children: Decline in tourist numbers to Japan blamed on manga's disaster prediction

image.altText: Gudkov

props.synopsis: Major General Mikhail Gudkov, a deputy commander of the Russian navy praised and promoted by Russia's president, has been killed "during combat work in one of the border districts of Kursk region", according to Moscow.

title.children: Top Russian commander praised by Putin killed near Ukrainian front line

image.altText: Two Palestinian women crying and embracing in a crowd.

props.synopsis: Hamas is seeking guarantees from the US that a ceasefire with Israel will lead to a lasting end to the war.

title.children: Deadly strikes hit Gaza as Israel intensifies campaign

image.altText: Five young women and a man stand together for a photo on a porch

props.synopsis: The man responsible for killing four Idaho university students has struck a plea deal with the prosecution — meaning some questions may never be answered.

title.children: Bryan Kohberger confessed to four murders — he may never have to explain why

image.altText: A man in dark clothes and sunglasses looking back at the camera

props.synopsis: A Queensland ferry driver nabbed in a police sting while trying to meet a 13-year-old boy has been jailed for his "vile" and "calculated" offending.

title.children: Ferry driver nabbed by police sting trying to meet 13yo boy via Snapchat

image.altText: Usher, wearing a fur coat, sings into a microphone.

props.synopsis: US singer Usher had been due to play 12 arena dates in Sydney and Melbourne towards the end of the year.

title.children: R&B star Usher cancels Australian arena tour without explanation

image.altText: Diogo Jota looks to the heavens and smiles

props.synopsis: Diogo Jota wasn't Liverpool's best player or the most famous. But he will be immortalised in a song that is proof of how deeply he wove himself into the fabric of the city.

title.children: Through one iconic song, Diogo Jota's legacy will live forever in Liverpool

image.altText: Oscar Piastri poses with a fan for a selfie photograph during a fan day

props.synopsis: Australia's Formula 1 drivers' championship leader Oscar Piastri says he believes any of the top four teams are in with a chance of victory at Silverstone this weekend.

title.children: Piastri expecting a 'good fight' with multiple drivers in Britain

image.altText: Two search and rescue dinghies on the water

props.synopsis: After temporarily halting a search for 29 people still missing after a ferry carrying 65 people sank near Bali, leaving at least six dead, authorities will resume their search for survivors today.

title.children: Body of three-year-old and mother recovered as Bali ferry search continues

image.altText: Olivia Rodrigo in a checked dress raises her sunglasses and pouts at her partner

props.synopsis: Here are some of the famous faces spotted in the crowd at Wimbledon, one of the world's most star-studded sports events.

title.children: Olivia Rodrigo and Louis Partridge among famous faces at Wimbledon

image.altText: A woman with short hair smiles standing in front of a Qantas airplane in a hangar.

props.synopsis: Qantas has sent emails to customers affected or potentially affected by a cyber attack, but it took two days for any of its senior executives to front the media.

title.children: Flying kangaroo goes to ground on data breach

image.altText: Muslim preacher Wissam Haddad arrives at court next to a man wearing a suit

props.synopsis: More than a decade ago political passions ran high in conservative circles about the alleged evils of 18C. This week it was only briefly back in the news cycle.

title.children: The issues that once caused political storms barely registered this week

image.altText: Andy Lee stands behind a stand and microphone in a recording booth with head phones on. His arms are up as he reads a line

props.synopsis: Andy Lee is no stranger to TV, but when it came to turning his best-selling kids' book into a show for the ABC, it was a process unlike anything he had experienced before.

title.children: Andy Lee's desperate plea: Do Not Watch This Show
